result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin D Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The sentence in Count #1 is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence, all other Counts are concurrent to Count #1

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268 
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge 
--To pay $2500 Surcharge ($500 per image) under 973.042(2)
--To pay $33 in summons fees

Court will not make these conditions of extended supervision since they will be paid today.

--Sex Offender Registration
--Psychosexual evaluation and follow through with all recommendations
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling, per Agent
--Obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No contact with any child under the age of 18, except for incidental contact as approved by the Agent
--No possession/use of any electronic device capable of accessing the internet, including cellphone or computer; the Court clarifies that the defendant would be allowed to use a cellphone if it's not capable of accessing the internet
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:07 pm [Clerk SH 2:07 - 2:20 pm; Clerk SF 2:20 pm- end]
Defendant Kevin D Clark in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Counts #1 - #5, the Court sentences Mr. Clark to 12 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 6 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 years, each count, concurrent. The sentence in Count #1 is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence, all other Counts are concurrent to Count #1.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 41 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Sex Offender Registration
--Psychosexual evaluation and follow through with all recommendations
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling, per Agent
--Obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No contact with any child under the age of 18, except for incidental contact as approved by the Agent
--No possession/use of any electronic device capable of accessing the internet, including cellphone or computer; the Court clarifies that the defendant would be allowed to use a cellphone if it's not capable of accessing the internet
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Court orders cash bond to be applied to costs, fees and surcharges, balance is to be refunded to the surety. 

Court will not make these conditions of extended supervision since they will be paid today.
--To pay costs of $1340 ($268 each count)
--To pay $1250 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To pay $2500 Surcharge ($500 per image) under 973.042(2)
--To pay $33 in summons fees

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence forms given to the Defendant
Recess: 3:12 pm
Letter from the defendant re sentencing
Defendant in-custody; to be held until sentencing
Extradition forecast

Case called at 10:36am [mo]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Kevin Clark does not appear.
Atty. De La Rosa informs the court that he did not notify Mr. Clark of todays hearing.
The Court notifies parties that Mr. Clark did receive notice of hearing for todays hearing
ADA Teuber requests a bench warrant and bond be forfeit in full
--Arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 
The Court issues a body only bench warrant. 
The Court revokes bond, and orders that Mr. Clark be held until sentencing.
recess: 10:38am
Sentencing hearing on June 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on May 12, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Motion to revoke bond submited by the State
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 9:17am [mo]
Defendant Kevin D Clark in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. Clark is prepared to enter a plea to Counts #1 through #5, with Counts #6 through #18 being Read-in and Dismissed as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.
Atty. Zarwell requests Sentencing to occur out 45 days to allow the attorney of record, Jeffrey De La Rosa, to be present.
No Objection from the State.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1, 2, 3, 4, & 5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Clark guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court Reads-in and Dismisses: all remaining counts

Mr. Clark's bond and its conditions will continue until sentencing.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:35am 
[off- record/post hearing: Attorney Zarwell indicates she has been mis-informed as to Attorney De La Rosa's availability and the sentencing date could be earlier. Counsel decides to leave the date as scheduled]

NEXT: SENTENCING: JUNE 25, 2015 AT 2:00PM
States
States notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
Jury trial on May 4 & 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 8:41am[MO]
Defendant Kevin D Clark in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that the State and Defense have not met resolution.
The State requests that the case be set for trial at this point, ADA Shock estimates needing 2 days for trial.
The Court clarifies to Mr. Clark that the April 28 FSSC is the final opportunity for any change of plea or other case resolution, thereafter the Court intends to proceed to trial.
Recess: 8:45am

NEXT:(1)FSSC: 4/28/15  (2)Jury Trial 5/4 and 5/5/2015 at 8:30
Status conference on February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 21, 2015 at 01:40 pm.
State's (with cover letter)
Scheduling Notice

Defendant Kevin D. Clark in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived
Plea of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Attorney De La Rosa requests a Pretrial Conference in about 30 days with a status 30 days after that. Defense has not received discovery yet.

recess: 8:49 am
NEXT:(Notices to be mailed)

Status: to be set (30 days after PTC)
Defendant's
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
Arraignment on December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
original bond document received from JESO 11/17/14
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 8:47 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kevin D Clark in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Clark waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
DA Happ requests matter be set for arraignment
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Atty De La Rosa orally motions to modify bond; arguments presented
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond
Recess: 8:57 am 

NEXT: (1) Arraignment scheduled for 12/1/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
From the State ref speedy request
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:54 pm
Defendant Kevin D Clark in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD appears for bond purposes only). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support the counts alleged.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Not view, access or possess any imagery that one must be an adult in order to lawfully view
-Not to be present in any establishment in which a person must be 18 years or older to enter them
-Not to have use of or accesss to any electronic device regardless of its nature if it is capable of accessing the internet, except if during work he is required to use such a device he is allowed to use such a a device so long as he does not run a foul of the courts orders
-Not to have any physical contact with any minor and not to be alone with any person that is a minor
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Must surrender any passport to the Clerk of Court

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 2:12 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 11/14/14 at 8:30 am
